bio: National Geographic Photographer | Filmmaker | Field Recordist | Writer | Storyteller - announcing 2019 workshop series soon. DM for details.

list.comment:
There are moments when you meet someone, even briefly, where kindness pours. Last evening we walked back from the Golden Temple in Amritsar to our simple hotel in the heart of this holy city. Across the street from the entrance was a glowing blue, a color beyond the light spectrum only seen in recent years, light so liquid it pours. Walking over briefly, I peeked into the rear opening of the LED lit rickshaw and asked the man if I could take is portrait. Bemused by my curiosity, he twisted gently in his seat, rested his arms and smiled, with his eyes. Strangely, there was no other light behind me. I thanked him after taking a few photos, crossing the street into the hotel. While in my room, I looked on this camera’s large glowing screen seeing something I hadn’t noticed in our brief moment together...pinch into this image, the eyes, seeing a most mystical twinkle, his smile glowing within.
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #amritsar #portrait #blue #electricblue #eyes

Still I have difficulty wrapping spirit and mind towards acts of direct visual simplicity. Yes, the world, our lives and the universe are complex, so maybe an image of sheer weightlessness is comforting. It helps that when I visited the Golden Temple in Amritsar, India, this simple image is most welcoming in its goldenness on the sacred night of Diwali...
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #amritsar #goldentemple #diwali #gold #sacredwater #candles #simplicity #peaceful #beauty

Sarjeet Singh, a poet on the pole, guiding us across the Sutlej River on our last day in the Punjab of northwest India before heading to Rajasthan.
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #portrait #hands #pole #boat #poleman #somewhereinthepunjab #punjab

Mesmerizing when a turban is spun, tied, especially such a gentle color. Dalveender Singh had just pulled a heavy wooden barge in the Sutlege River, loosing his near perfect headdress when we met in the Punjab, India.
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #portrait #turban #Sikh #somewhereinthepunjab #punjab #peach

This day I met Labh Singh, a roadside shop owner where we sipped cups of his sweet chai, dipped biscuits, when taking a break driving from Amritsar to Bathinda. I much prefer color, in b&w it felt more as the mindful fellow I met, so stoic he was, more revealing. To see the same portrait in color, watch my latest Instagram Story. And thank you so much for all the private messages so many of you send each day. Yes, I would love to meet everyone throughout this month long assignment in northern India, and to be honest, there simply isn’t time. Let the beauty of serendipity find us at the same place, sipping chai...
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #portrait #somewhereinthepunjab #punjab

Two young girls originally from Uttar Pradesh, the teenager a farm hand, the younger girl’s future unknown, both living on a farm in the Punjab, India. Today is World Children’s Day, a time of importance for millions of young girls and boys across our earth with marginal access to education, proper healthcare or opportunities. What is their futures if this cycle continues? What is our collective future if we do not support and lift children out of poverty...
#worldchildrensday #children #girls #farm @natgeo @natgeoimagecollection

One more from Istanbul, two days before returning to Turkey. Here with a kind fellow I met on my last visit, cleaning the ablution area at a mosque in the city of a million stories.
@natgeo @natgeoimagecollection #turkey #istanbul @viiphoto #ablutions #water

She made it look so simple. Her ballet while holding a massive bouquet of tan flowers, heaving rice grains upon an overflowing harvest. I took a turn at rice harvesting the other day at this farm, one of the limitless rice fields that fill this northwest part of India. Doing it once was pleasant, multiple times, a reminder of being thankful to this gently smiling lady in pink I met, and to all those who by hand, provide us food.
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #rice #basmatirice #riceharvet #farming #somewhereinthepunjab #punjab #woman #womenlabor #pink

This is Gian Kaur. She has cancer, is so beautiful in her strength and being. Mari Mustafa, Punjab, India.
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #india #portrait #farmer #somewhereinthepunjab #punjab #woman #greeneyes #eyes

On a visit last night to Pushkar, I became rather numbed by just how many photographs one can make of camels laying about the ever presence of tourist ‘clickers.’ Within a few hours I began missing the Thar Desert. Today we drive back north, posthaste after camel inundation, to clear the mind by these centuries-old wells, abandoned by humans, adored by buffaloes, and me.
#onassignment @natgeo @outofedenwalk @natgeoimagecollection #harasar #india #well #rainwater #water #buffalo #twotrees #somewhereinrajasthan #rajasthan

100 Days...2,400 hours...144,000 minutes...8,640,000 seconds...my friend Shahidul Alam has been held in prison, tortured, denied bail 5 times, for the weakest, most impish reason...”spreading propaganda and false information against the government" by hurting the image of the nation... #bangladesh #freeshahidul #freeshahidulalam
